Hey! I am Ludovico, I am currently working as a Software engineer - Machine learning at Google Zurich. I am developing ML models to defend gmail users: It‚Äôs pretty cool! In the past, before graduating with a MSc in Applied mathematics, I have interned all over Europe at: CERN, VolvoCars, Alan turing institute and ClearBox.

I have also partecipated in the ‚ÄúGoogle summer of code‚Äù framework, where I developed a new open source library called ‚ÄúSurrogates.jl‚Äù for the Julia - scientific machine learning community. I am a strong believer in open source software and I plan to get back to it sooner or later. :)

What‚Äôs this website about?

In this website, I will be writing about:

  • My coding interview preparation: passing coding interviews
  • My (ML) System design preparation: passing (ML) system design
  • ML in industry, mainly describing company blog posts related to Applied ML and MLOps.
  • My learning path for ML, divided in roughly 6 macro areas: Computer vision, Reinforcement learning, Scientific machine learning, Geometric deep learning, Natural language processing and Probabilistic machine learning,
  • Probability riddles. Once upon a time, I was an Applied mathematician who wanted to go into quant research and probability is my favourite area of Mathematics. I still really like probability!

All this resources are mainly for my own learning, but I figured It‚Äôd be good to share them in the public. In this way, I have something to keep myself in check and I can get some nice discussions going with interesting people.

Blog

I really like writing, so I will keep a little blog where I discuss everythig about my career, and where I will write updates about all the cool things I will be learning! If you want to stay updated about all the content that‚Äôs coming out, feel free to subscribe to my newsletter:

You can expect around one email per month with a review of everything I publish here and in my blog.
